attributes.action: Petition for the media to stop using the term “Asian” when describing criminals.
attributes.additional_details: A perfect example is of a Sikh man, whose turban was pulled off outside parliament in 2018, whilst attacker shouted “Muslims go back”. A lack of knowledge for the public and generalisation in media, is creating unsettling environments.
attributes.background: This petition is for the media to stop using the word “Asian” when describing criminals and their crimes. This generalises all Asian religions, and confuses non Asian people as to true identity or ethnic background of individuals, creating hostile environments and unsettlement amongst communities.

rejection.details:
This petition is calling on the media, not the UK Government or Parliament, to take action.

Complaints about the press are the responsibility of the Independent Press Standards Organisation (IPSO), not  the Government or Parliament. 

If you wish to make a complaint to IPSO, you can do so by clicking on the link below and following the instructions:

https://www.ipso.co.uk/IPSO/makeacomplaint.html
